programme.desc: M-1 Challenge is an MMA competition organized with a series of events held in many places around the world. The shows feature the best local and international fighters with spectacular Kos and submissions.

programme.title: Enfusion Reality Season 1, episode 7
programme.desc: Edwin has something important to tell the ladies…and for Kaas its a lot of falling down in his fight against Michael Lallemand.

programme.title: Enfusion Reality Season 1, episode 4
programme.desc: At the Superpro Samui hotel at Koh Samui 18, warriors train hard to be in top shape for their fight. They really suffer to make the 70kilogram weight. All the fighters give everything they have to be succesfull. Armen Petrosyan is afraid of nobody but a parrot and Mirko and Alex have a real battle at Petch Buncha Stadium.

programme.title: The New Heroic Picture of Thomas Andrews
programme.desc: Every film and every documentary show Thomas Andrews at the end in the first-class smoking room in front of the fireplace staring up at a painting. Kent Layton and his co-authors have uncovered sources that give us a very different account of Mr....

programme.title: Did the Lifeboats Douse Their Lights?
programme.desc: Evidence seems to suggest that lifeboats doused their lights to avoid being overcome by survivors in the water. It is indeed a grim side of the Titanic story. Senan Molony gives us the full account of what happened that night.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 2
programme.desc: For underwater explorers, the 400-foot dive to Britannic is at the apex of technical diving. Richie Kohler relates his harrowing life and death experience on Britannic in 2009.

programme.title: Should Titanic Have Turned into the Iceberg?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson takes on the popular controversy that instead of trying to avoid the iceberg, maybe Titanic should have just turned directly into it? Could this have really saved Titanic?

programme.title: Expansion Joints
programme.desc: Harland & Wolff decided to fit expansion joints into Olympic’s superstructure to protect the ships deck houses. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside tells us how they worked and why they were needed.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 1
programme.desc: Shipwreck explorer, Richie Kohler takes us without a submersible to the warm blue waters of the Aegean Sea and the remarkably preserved HMHS Britannic. Kohler reveals what it’s like to swim freely through the passageways of one of the largest...

programme.title: An Experience of A Lifetime Diving Titanic
programme.desc: He was the first school teacher to dive Titanic, not once - but twice. In this very candid account, Titanic channel host Charles Haas tells us how nerves almost kept him from going. In the end, his journey to his beloved Titanic proved to be an exciting...

programme.title: Two Bath Tubs
programme.desc: There were only two bathtubs for all 709 Third Class passengers aboard Titanic. Sauder explains why probably no one in Third Class complained!

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Titanic's Most Refined Features
programme.desc: Titanic Historian Bill Sauder continues his look at Titanic’s remarkable First Class Lounge. In this episode, Sauder reveals the architectural and decorative point of view and shows why the room was a showcase onboard the ship.

programme.title: Another View on the Coal Burning Fire
programme.desc: A recent documentary presented new theories about the coal burning fire onboard Titanic. Parks Stephenson gives his view of the fire and how it affected Titanic. Senan Molony and Parks Stephenson, two of our hosts, are on Titanic’s center stage!

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: The Lost Documents of Titanic: The Log Books
programme.desc: What could the log books from the Titanic and the Californian tell us today? Would they shed any light on the operations of either ship that night? In part one of this two-part series, Titanic Channel Host and author Charles Haas speculates what we might...

programme.title: Kicking the Tires
programme.desc: It’s always been debated how much influence Bruce Ismay had on Captain Smith’s operation of the ship on her fateful voyage. Senan Molony gives us a look at a rare photo that may offer some answers.

programme.title: The J.J. Davies Bag
programme.desc: As bodies were recovered on the Mackay-Bennett, they were given a number and the personal items found on the body were put into a mortuary bag. This is the real life story of one of those bags from Body No. 200!

programme.title: Thomas Andrews’ Notes - Mark Chirnside
programme.desc: When Olympic made her maiden voyage in June 1911 from Southampton to New York, Thomas Andrews traveled onboard to observe and take notes on potential improvements for Titanic and other ships. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals how the suggested...

programme.title: The Gimbal Lamp
programme.desc: One of the features that really set Titanic apart from other ships was her interior illumination. Titanic Channel Host, Bill Sauder, introduces us to a simple, versatile lamp that was used throughout the ship.

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: Memories from the Big Movie Part 1
programme.desc: Ken Marschall take us behind the scenes for a remarkable look at the making of James Cameron’s Titanic. If you’ve ever wondered how they built the ship and everything around it to look so real, this is an episode you can’t miss.

programme.title: Titanic’s Sunday Night Hymn Sing
programme.desc: The last formal social event on Titanic was the Sunday night hymn sing held in the second class dining saloon. Titanic Channel Host Robert Bracken provides us with new details about how this evening was destined to affect so many lives.

programme.title: Titanic's Second Class Carnage
programme.desc: Senan Molony calls the second class, “the forgotten class.” The men suffered, “absolute carnage,” they didn’t have a chance! Senan gives us a sobering look at what it was like as a second-class passenger the night Titanic sank.

programme.title: The Titanic Post Office
programme.desc: Titanic was carrying 3,423 sacks of mail! The mailbags contained over 7 million pieces of mail! The Sea Post Office on board the ship was big business for White Star. Craig Sopin gives us the inside story on the Royal Mail Steamer that failed to deliver...

programme.title: The Identity Conspiracy
programme.desc: Was Titanic really swapped with Olympic? It’s a conspiracy theory that just will not die! Parks Stephenson may have the eyewitness accounts that will finally put all the conspiracy talk to rest.

programme.title: Golden Trail World Series 2022 - Zegama (Eng)
programme.desc: "Zegama is Zegama” The Basque Fever. Only a few lucky runners have the opportunity to run through the Basque Country’s highest peaks and fall under the spectators’ charms who cheer them on at every step. A town with just over 1,500 inhabitants is transformed to become the trail running epicenter for a unique weekend.

programme.title: Super League Triathlon Toulouse 2023
programme.desc: After a hugely successful debut in 2022, Super League Triathlon returned to France, and the stunning city of Toulouse, for the second event on our 2023 Championship Series. Following the opening race of the 2023 season, in London, the SLT travelling circus will head to ‘La Ville Rose’, the pink city of Toulouse, with Super League providing a rare chance for the dedicated French triathlon fans to see their heroes up close and personal in what promises to be a thrilling race.

programme.title: Bahrain Victorious Scorpions: Every Point Counts | Triathlon Racing Short
programme.desc: Follow the Bahrain Victorious Scorpions in the 2022 Championship Series campaign. Can the big budget team live up to the hype and take the top step? Star athletes Georgia Taylor-Brown and Cassandre Beuagrand will be battling for the winners crown themselves. Will they be able to put their rivalry aside to help secure the team a trophy?

programme.title: Adamello Ultra Trail 2023 - 170 km
programme.desc: The Adamello Ultra-Trail® is a trail running race of 170 km in length and about 11,500 m of elevation gain, to be covered in semi-self-sufficiency, organized by the ASD Adamello Ultra-Trail in collaboration with the Union of the Upper Camonica Valley Municipalities. The maximum time allowed to finish the race is 53 hours.

programme.title: The First Second - Laetitia-roux
programme.desc: Championne de France la plus titrée de tous les temps, Laetitia Roux a une capacité presque irréelle à relever des défis dans lun des sports les plus difficiles. Sa formation peut être une école de la vie. Son esprit naturel de compétition solo se transforme en travail déquipe et en partage. Avec le ski alpinisme, vous la voyez dans son élément : haute, vive, rapide et amusante…..

programme.title: Ungrounded Episode 3 - Meredith Edwards
programme.desc: Meredith Edwards is an elite-level mountain ultra runner, with podium finishes at the Ultra-Trail du Mont-Blanc TDS race, the Javelina Jundred 100K and the Flagstaff Skyrace 55K. She is also a member of the U.S. Ski Mountaineering Team. In Episode 3, she reveals how in 2019 she fought an inner struggle with her body that almost resulted in a full blood transfusion-and came back from it to win one of the world’s most challenging Ultra Marathons. (English version with French, German, Italian and Spanish subtitles available)

programme.title: Inside my borders - Sicily (Eng)
programme.desc: Michele, our backpacker friend, is forced to travel inside his Italian borders due to the travel restrictions following the Covid crisis. This time no biking but a long walk across Sicily on the Magna Via Francigena from Palermo to Agrigento, an ancient road already used by the Romans as early as in the 2nd century BC. This is a 187 km walk divided into 9 stages. All along the way, Michele enjoys gorgeous natural scenery, lots of hills and climbs, prehistoric sites, beautiful villages such as the famous Corleone, Prizzi, Sutera and several others. He will also have the pleasure to taste the famous Cannoli and several other gastronomic Sicilian specialties.

programme.title: Marathon Des Sables 2023 #3
programme.desc: Marathon Des Sables 2023 Day 3. Marked by the two previous stages, the faces of the 958 competitors at the start of the third stage of the 37th MARATHON DES SABLES showed signs of anxiety. Since the beginning of the race, 127 participants have left the pack, badly affected by the desert, the effort, and the difficult living conditions at the bivouac.Marathon Des Sables 2023 Jour 3. Marqués par les deux journées précédentes, les visages des 958 concurrents au départ de la troisième étape du 37e MARATHON DES SABLES laissaient poindre l’anxiété. Depuis le début de la course, 127 participants ont quitté le peloton, malmenés par le désert, l’effort et les conditions de vie difficiles sur le bivouac.

programme.title: Road To One Water Race Ep8 - Pre Race
programme.desc: One Water Race is an endurance race based on Running, Swimming and Orienteering. 7 mixed teams of 7 athletes have to cross the Stockholm-Sweden archipelago from North to South in a non-stop 250 km race with 200 km of running and 50 km of swimming. They have to completely handle their navigation including in the darkness. Road to One Water Race Ep8 shows how everyone is getting ready for the big race

programme.title: Expedition Antarctica of extreme sports woman Caro North
programme.desc: Iceclimbing, ski mountaineering and sailing the open water for days through the infamous Drake Passage: The 28 years old extreme sports woman Caro North made her way to the very South of our continent for a four weeks expedition – accompanied by an eight-member crew. Antarctica turned out to be a paradise for extreme sports: deserted landscapes and snow-capped mountains against a surreal backdrop of ice and sea were waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2024 - Episode 9
programme.desc: This episode starts with a come back to the Rolex Jumping Grand Prix in Aachen Germany. We then go to Croatia for the Pannonian Challenge featuring skate board and BMX. After that we head to Kaunas Lithuania for the AIDA freediving world championship. Then we fly to Canada for the Challenge Family triathlon event in Québec. Then we go to Sardinia, Italy, for the Rally di Sardegna MTB. We then stay with mountain biking in Peru for the Genesis Inca MTB. Finally, we enjoy Greek beauty on the Zagori Mountain Running event.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show 2023 Episode 3
programme.desc: We start with the 46th edition of the Dobbiaco-Cortina Cross Country Race in northern Italy. We then completely switch terrains to watch the Oman Desert Marathon. We then move to Spain, as 2023 will mark the 25th anniversary of the Portocolom Triathlon. Until now there was no measurable fitness race for everybody. HYROX is the ultimate challenge, a perfect combination between strength, endurance and determination.

programme.title: Otam 80 HT - The perfect configuration
programme.desc: In Rapallo, discover the new Otam 80 HT, considered the most iconic boat in the Otam range. Enjoy this exclusive review by our Maurizio Bulleri.

programme.title: Pure fascination
programme.desc: Discover the Wally Better Place, 50 meters of pure fascination, with a great hull, designed by Bill Tripp. This incredible sailboat is the biggest sloop made of carbon ever built. The exterior is very innovative and so is the interior, with its very impressive spaces.

programme.title: Itama 62 RS - Class and sportiness
programme.desc: Itama has a great knowledge of the sea and boats, so it is no wonder that the boats produced are timeless, just like the Itama 62 RS. Discover this elegant and sporty model and its incredible hull.

programme.title: WallyWhy200 - A revolutionary yacht
programme.desc: Our Antonio Vettese brings you on board the revolutionary WallyWhy200, an ultra-luxury yacht that will blow your mind. This model is innovative in many aspects, one of them is the ground-breaking owner’s suite at the bow, where the hull has been thoroughly studied to ensure that silence and comfort are preserved, even at maximum speed.

programme.title: Mangusta Oceano 50 - Flibs 2022
programme.desc: The Boat Show is in Ft. Lauderdale on board the Mangusta Oceano 50, built with the idea of a big beach club and great design.

programme.title: Pearl 72 - Flibs 2022
programme.desc: Worldwide premier of the Pearl 72, discover this incredible flybridge with many areas where to relax. Exceptional seakeeping, designed to follow the success of its sistership.

programme.title: Fountain Pajot Elba 45 – Live your dream
programme.desc: Live your dream on board aboard the cruising catamaran 45 Elba by Fontaine Pajot. Very sleek, stylish and easy to maneuver, even solo.

programme.title: Elan i43 - Boot 2023
programme.desc: The Boat Show is at the Boot di Düsseldorf to discover the new Elan i43, shown for the first time. Hop on board to find out more about this vessel.

programme.title: Aventura 37 - International Multihull Show 2023.
programme.desc: The Boat Show is in La Grande-Motte, at the International Multihull Show 2023. Get on board with Federico Maselli.

programme.title: SF 400 - A small sailboat
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is on board the SF 400, a sailboat designed for an ownerlover of the Gulf of Trieste and regattas. Built in Slovenia by Ocean Tec isoptimized for a light wind.

programme.title: 151 Miglia - Best of 2023
programme.desc: The Boat Show takes you to the best moments of the 2023 edition of the 151 Miglia, Cetilar Trophy.

programme.title: Spartivento Charter (Eng)
programme.desc: Federico Maselli introduces you to Spartivento, one of the most successful sailing and catamaran charter companies. The fleet has the latest models from the most exclusive shipyards, on board which you can enjoy the wonders and hidden glimpses of Italy. For you, an exclusive interview with Iole Pizzi, Spartivento Marketing Manager.

programme.title: A special novelty
programme.desc: In America there is a high demand for sailboats, and people are queuing to visit the Lagoon 46, a high quality catamaran that is a performant and spacious novelty.

programme.title: Italia Yachts - The Shipyard
programme.desc: Our Bacci Del Buono takes you on an exclusive visit to the shipyard of Italia Yachts, a builder of high-quality sailboats located in Ostellato. How are they built? We have heard about the Sales Manager of the brand.

programme.title: Swan 55 – A winning bet
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is on board the new sailing Yacht Swan 55 seen at Cannes International Boat Show 2022. Discover its performance.

programme.title: Outremer 52 - International Multihull Show 2023
programme.desc: Hop on board the sailing catamaran Outremer 52, presented at the International Multihull Show 2023 in La Grande-Motte.

programme.title: Hanse 460 – Annapolis Boat Show 2022
programme.desc: Sail on board the Hanse 460, seen at Annapolis Boat Show 2022. Bill Hackett interviews Ken Comerford, from North Point Yacht Sales.

programme.title: Swan 108 – Prolific harmonious delicacy
programme.desc: We are touring the proclaimed best boat ever made by Nautor, Swan 108, that is packed with innovations and advanced technology, it is truly a wonderful boat.

programme.title: Miami Boat Show 2020 - Sailing boats
programme.desc: Do you want to cross the Atlantic or perhaps charter in the Caribbean? Whatever you are looking for, you will find it at the Miami Boat Show, where American market trends meet varied needs. This is the place to be.

programme.title: Hallberg Rassy - The Shipyard
programme.desc: Hallberg-Rassy is a company is based in Ellos, Sweden, and it has been building sailing boats since 1943. It is specialised in building bluewater sailing yachts. Our Federico Maselli is on-site to Show you around.

programme.title: Effortless sailing
programme.desc: Our Antonio Vettese brings you on board the Hylas 60, by Hylas Yachts. The design of the exterior has been entrusted to the care of German Frers, who continue its long partnership with the shipyard. Jump on board this bluewater cruising yacht and start sailing!

programme.title: Hallberg Rassy 50 - Explore, dream, discover
programme.desc: Sail away in the deep waters of the oceans and get ready to explore the distant continents in safety on board the Hallberg-Rassy 50.

programme.title: A maxi sailboat
programme.desc: The Boat Show is on board the Swan 98, a sailboat built in Finland by Nautors Swan. It is part of the shipyards maxi series and is an elegant project, signed by Germàn Frers. Entirely in carbon, this is a boat with great autonomy and comfort.

programme.title: 151 Miglia - Best of 2022 (Eng)
programme.desc: The Boat Show takes you to the best moments of the 13th edition of the 151 Miglia, Cetilar Trophy. With Bacci Del Buono aboard one of the largest and fastest boats, the Vismar 80.

programme.title: Contest 50 CS - Boot 2023
programme.desc: Discover the Contest 50 CS, premiering at the Boot alongside its smaller sister. This beautiful bluewater is ideal for demanding navigation in the often stormy North Sea.

programme.title: Regatta or cruise
programme.desc: An all-Italian sailboat and a unique opportunity. The Boat Show is on board Scuderia 65 and with Antonio Vettese there are the owner, the designer, the builder and the designer of the sails.

programme.title: Arcona 415 Z - Boot 2023
programme.desc: The Boat Show brings you to the Boot in Dusseldorf, on board the Arcona 415 Zero Emission. Discover it with Federico Maselli.

programme.title: An important sailing maxi yacht
programme.desc: Hop on board the sailing maxi-yacht Solaris 111, the largest boat built to date by Solaris Sail Yachts, designed for Marc Giorgetti, President of Solaris Yachts Group. Thanks to its generous dimensions, its essential and elegant interior and exterior spaces are widely habitable.

programme.desc: After narrowly escaping with her life at the hands of her mentally ill sister Veronica, Monica, with the help of her Mother, Marion, has taken great measures to ensure her safety, including changing her face and relocating to the South. Six years has past and now she finally believes she is safe from Veronica. Little does she know that death and betrayal still await her and her friends on the eve of her wedding at a southern plantation house rumored to be haunted by 13 murdered slaves. This time no one is safe and everyone is a suspect as killing becomes addictive.

programme.title: Jumper on CA RT 99 with Eng 13
programme.desc: Firefighter Keola Park who youve see on Engine 3, is now part of the water rescue and USAR teams. He starts his day before his shift with a boot in his hand on a busy corner as part of the "Fill the Boot for Jerrys Kids" drive. 1st call, a gas leak, then off to water rescue training with the team at the pool. Then they all meet at the river with fast moving currents, for Keola, this is his first time. Afternoon shopping for the next 48 hours, and back to the station for a sit down lunch. Night, a call comes in, a man is standing on a giant road sign attached to the crossing bridge high above the California 99 Highway, and hes cutting his wrists, the road is closed in both ways and hes got an audience.

programme.title: Willie Nelson - Live at iTunes Festival
programme.desc: ITunes Festival, is an annual music festival that takes place over a month in London. Sponsored by Apple Inc., it had its first edition in 2007.

programme.title: Alabama Shakes - Austin City Limits
programme.desc: Mixing classic R&B vocals with a soulful blues-rock base, Alabama Shakes have taken garage rock and turned it on its head. Alabama Shakes takes the Austin City Limits stage for the second time in support of their newest album Sound & Color.

programme.title: Phil Collins - Rock Legends
programme.desc: Phil Collins was born in 1951 in Hounslow, London. His mother was a theatrical agent, whilst his father worked in insurance. Despite appearances on the stage, his interest was in music from an early age. Collins focussed on his solo material and film soundtracks, after Genesis. In 1981, Collins he released his debut solo single, “In The Air” Tonight. He is one of only three solo artists who have sold over a 100 million records. Featuring archive material, music videos “Invisible Touch” and “Everyday” and, exclusive insights from music critics and journalists Michael Bonner (Uncut Magazine), Hamish MacBain (Shortlist), John Aizlewood (Evening Standard)

programme.title: Foreigner - Rock Legends
programme.desc: Patti Smith - Patricia Lee Smith (born December 30, 1946) is an American singer-songwriter, poet, and visual artist who became an influential component of the New York City punk rock movement with her 1975 debut album Horses.

programme.title: Hozier - Live at Coachella
programme.desc: The Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival is an annual music and arts festival held at the Empire Polo Club in Indio, California, in the Coachella Valley

programme.title: Earth From Above
programme.desc: Travel the world with a birds-eye-view perspective in this breathtaking trip to scenic wonders.

programme.title: Auckland Beaches: New Zealand
programme.desc: Enjoy the relaxing vibe of a day at the beach with a tour of the breathtaking coastlines near Auckland.

programme.title: Rainbow Reef Relaxation 2
programme.desc: Sit back, relax and enjoy the dazzling world of coral reefs in 4K you embark on a journey through some of the most vibrant underwater reefs on our blue planet - including many scenes which no longer look like this due to coral bleaching. From the cinematographer: "The footage for this film was shot over a period of some years in French Polynesia, Micronesia, Indonesia and East Timor. Unfortunately there are not that vibrant anymore today. Coral reefs have suffered from the rise of water temperature, rise in acidity, destructive fishing methods and severe storms caused by climate change." - Peter Schneider. "Rainbow Reef Relaxation" is a 3-hour long, sweeping yet majestic & vibrant underwater journey to the world's most beautiful lagoons, as captured by Nature Relaxation collaborator Peter Schneider (Underwatercam) paired with ambient underwater sounds and brand new ambient music by the Cynic Project. Filmed in High Definition several years ago, thanks to its age this film offers magical glimpses of an underwater world that is bursting with life, color, and beauty.

programme.title: A Day in the Caribbean 3
programme.desc: A Day in the Caribbean transports viewers miles away from it all, to the gorgeous tropical island of Antigua. Arriving just at dawn, you'll enjoy a stunning golden sunrise and rainbow, followed by a couple hours of beautiful beach scenes as you explore the beautiful resort surroundings. Abundant, vibrant vistas will instantly transform your screen into a window to the glorious Caribbean - with nothing but the pure sounds of nature to accompany it. (Music version coming soon though)

programme.title: Sunny Getaways
programme.desc: Unwind by an idyllic stretch of sand where time stands still surrounded by luxurious flora and light navy blue waters.

programme.title: Mademoiselle Karen, Jakob Munch, Danish National Symphony Orchestra & Emma Smith - The Babylon Hotel
programme.desc: One night only! Welcome to the spectacular and decadent world of The Babylon Hotel, where music pours out of every crevice like bubbling champagne. In this concert, the upper class meets the underworld in a melting pot of euphoria and extravagance, nostalgia and pleasure with a carefree sinfulness only seen in the exuberant nightlife of the 1920s around the world. The concert features iconic music from movies and series, such as The Great Gatsby, Burlesque, and Babylon Berlin. The music is performed by the Danish National Symphony Orchestra and DR Big Band under the direction of Miho Hazama. The concert also features the Moka Efti Orchestra, and singers Madame le Pustra, Emma Smith, Mademoiselle Karen, Jakob Munch, and Nikko Weidemann, as well as dancers of Sweet Burlesque. This performance was recorded at the DR Koncerthuset in Copenhagen, Denmark, in May 2023.

programme.title: Seong-Jin Cho - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Ludwig Wicki, Danish National Symphony Orchestra, DR Junior Choir & Andrea Lykke Oehlenschlæger - Hollywood Gala
programme.desc: Swiss conductor Ludwig Wicki leads the Danish National Symphony Orchestra and the DR Junior Choir in a sparkling concert program of film music. The program features a selection of music from great and Oscar-winning Hollywood films, including Titanic, The Bodyguard, Pirates of the Caribbean, Braveheart, and Moulin Rouge, written by major composers such as John Williams, Hans Zimmer, James Horner, and Klaus Badelt. Highlights include ‘He’s a pirate/Davy Jones’ from Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man’s Chest; ‘Now We Are Free’ from Gladiator; ‘My Heart Will Go On’ from Titanic; and ‘Shallow’ from A Star Is Born. Featured soloists in this concert are the young talented singers Andrea Lykke Oehlenschlæger and Diluckshan Jeyaratnam. This performance was recorded at the DR Koncerthuset in Copenhagen, Denmark, in May 2022.

programme.title: Claudio Abbado - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Pavel Milyukov & Boris Berezovsky - Works for violin by Franck, Fauré, Schubert a.o.
programme.desc: Russian violinist Pavel Milyukov and pianist Boris Berezovsky join forces in this concert recorded at Tchaikovsky Concert Hall in Moscow, Russia, on October 15, 2020. Milyukov has won prizes at various international competitions and has appeared at venues throughout Europe. He forms an excellent chamber music duo with acclaimed pianist Boris Berezovsky. On this concert’s program are César Franck’s Sonata for violin and piano; Gabriel Fauré’s Après un rêve; Alfred Schnittke’s Stille Nacht; and Franz Schubert’s Erlkönig. As an encore, the duo performs ‘Russian Song’ from Igor Stravinsky’s opera Mavra (arranged by S. Dushkin).

programme.title: Buster Williams - Ode to Miles: Bitches Brew Beyond
programme.desc: For the 40th anniversary of jazz legend Miles Davis' legendary album Bitches Brew, trumpeter Wallace Roney leads a band that revives the master's music. This project is the brainchild of Miles' family (including his son Erin), which is represented by his nephew, drummer Vince Wilburn. This concert at the ancient theater in Vienne, France, is a grand tribute to Miles.

programme.title: Bill Evans - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Stochelo Rosenberg & Peter Beets - Django Reinhardt Tribute: Beets & Rosenberg
programme.desc: The treasured compositions of guitarist Django Reinhardt, the founding father of hot club jazz, are engraved in everyone's memory. Although Reinhardt missed two fingers of his left hand, his virtuoso technique was unrivalled. Dutch guitarist Stochelo Rosenberg and pianist Peter Beets now have the pleasure to bring Django’s music back to life with their infectious improvisations.

programme.title: Art Blakey - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Curtis Stigers - Curtis Stigers - Fly Me To The Moon

Curtis Stigers and the big band present the most popular evergreens from the American songbook of the 1950s and 1960s, one of which is the classic that lend the concert its name: “Fly Me To The Moon”.

programme.title: Jazzmeia Horn - He's My Guy
programme.desc: Vocalist Jazzmeia Horn’s 2019 Malta Jazz Festival appearance was a celebration of jazz’s future, infused with the soul of its past. Featuring Keith Brown (piano), Rashaan Carter (bass), Irwin Hall (flute and saxophone), and Anwar Marshall (drums), the young singer’s performance was a reminder of jazz’s enduring power to speak to the heart. Situated at the Valletta waterfront outside Our Lady of Liesse Church, Horn’s concert was a truly spellbinding experience.

programme.title: Roy Ayers - Portrait of Roy Ayers
programme.desc: ‘The legend of the groove’ is a series of documentaries devoted to the musicians who were most influential on contemporary hip hop, soul, rhythm 'n' blues, and on the course of history. Between the late 1950s and now, these musicians radically changed music. Although sometimes hardly in the public eye, they have all been major sources of inspiration for today's major artists: Prince, Erykah Badu, Janis Joplin and Jimi Hendrix.

programme.title: In Dancin Days of Dawn
programme.desc: In Dancing Days of Dawn is a debut feature surf documentary sure to leave you wanting for those early days of stoke. This story is a poetic look into the mind of Chris Miyashiro, the visionary behind the film. A wild journey to find purpose and meaning, told from the childlike perspective of an artist. Chris also known as “Mowgli” was born and raised in Hawaii. After growing up surfing, skating and doodling in his notebook, Mowgli decided to pursue something different than his peers. Thus birthed his passion for storytelling. In Dancing Days Of Dawn is the beginning of a lifelong creative outlet for the young islander. Official Selections 2019: Florida Surf Film Festival, Honolulu Surf Film Festival, Portuguese Surf Film Festival, Make Waves Film Fest, KSFF.

programme.title: Beni SpeedTransalp
programme.desc: For this route from Ruhpolding (GER) to Kasern (ITA), 210 kilometers and more than 10000 meters of vert, recreational athletes need approximately five to seven days. Benedikt Boehm is aiming for the magic time limit of 36 hours, non-stop. The risk of complete exhaustion is very big during this project. In 2006, Beni did this same route on touring skis together with five colleagues. With the name of “Hannibal,” the six athletes broke the then-record time of three days for the route. Mention d'Honneur - FICTS 2020. Official Selection 2021: Orobie Film Festival. Official Selections 2020: Hory a Mesto, Galil Adventure Film Festival, Aspen Mountain Film Festival, Alpin Film Festival, Fort William Mountain Festival, New Zeland Mountain Film Festival, XXIII Cervino CineMountain, Trento Film Festival, INKAFEST Mountain Film Fest, Winter Film Festival. Official Selections 2019: Bansko Mountain Film Festival, Mondovì Film Festival, Milano Montagna Week, Mountain & Adventure Film Festival, Alp-Con Cinematour.

programme.title: The People and The Olive
programme.desc: The Story of The Run Across Palestine. An inspiring feature-length documentary about the daily struggles and joys of Palestinian olive farmers. When a group of American ultra marathoners sets out to run 129 miles in 5 days across the West Bank they discover that in replanting uprooted olive trees they are planting hope and building cultural bridges.

programme.title: Polheim
programme.desc: Polheim tells the story of three young explorers given a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity; to ski across Antarctica with the Antarctic Heritage Trust’s Inspiring Explorers Expedition™ to the South Pole in celebration of 150 years since the birth of Roald Amundsen, the first person to reach the bottom of the world. Not only will they have the physical challenge of 'man-hauling' sleds nearly 1000km in extreme weather conditions, they will also face an internal battle - 50 days of isolation in the most remote environment on the planet, with team members who are essentially strangers. The film explores themes of mortality, ambition, family and the history of polar exploration. Spirit of Adventure Award - New Zealand International Mountain Film Festival 2024. Official Selections 2024: Vancouver International Mountain Film Festival, London Mountain Film Festival.

programme.title: UFA 355-356 - CFC Mursa
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Centurion Fighting Championship 16 Mursa part 1 from Malta. In a four man tournament, Jonathan Carlos out of Brazil who is on a winning streak faces Argentinian Matias Juarez. Next up two Brazilians battle to move on in the tournament as Joao Luis Nogueira takes on Felipe Douglas. United Fight Alliance presents Centurion Fighting Championship 16 Mursa part 2 from Malta. In a boxing contest, Italian Damiano Calicchia gets in the cage with Cleavin Falzon of Malta. Also, watch as the winners of the semi-finals four man tournament battle for the win to move on to the championship in Brazil.

programme.title: UFA 360-362 - KOK 104 World Series Kaunas
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 104 World Series Kaunas, Lithuania part 1. Starting the night is a lightweight match between Tiago Mendes and Champion Mindaugas Narauskas. Nika Khelaidze takes on Vitoldas Jagelo in an MMA Bushido contest, Jussi Pirttikangas faces Erikas Golubovskis, Nicola Kisari, making his pro-debut, and Nauris Lukosiunas face off in a Romania versus Lithuania matchup. Also watch Bruno Borges from Portugal take on Lithuanian Samuelis Sorochovas. United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 104 World Series Kaunas, Lithuania part 2. In this episode Soslan Gasiev faces former heavyweight champion Tomas Pakutinskas, up and comers Arnestas Naujokas and Gustas Dimsa faceoff in the ring, Polands Jakub Kwasniewski faces charasmatic Vitas Karosas from Lithuania, experienced fighters Filip Rzadek and Ignas Barysas look to make their match fight of the night. United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 104 World Series Kaunas, Lithuania part 3. First up Moldovanian Nicolai Garbuz faces Mantas Kondratavicius of Lithuania in an MMA Bushido bout and Sasa Polugic takes on Mantas Rimdeika for some heavyweight action. In the main event Simon Santana and Matas Pultarazinskas head to the ring for a featherweight bout with the World Championship up for grabs.

programme.title: UFA 313-315 - KOK 100 Tallinn
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents KOK 100 from Tallinn, Estonia part 1. Benas Sorochovas from Lithuania takes on Stanislav Teniugin of Estonia, Andreas Tavast of Estonia faces Emil Linnas of Finland in a debut match. In a female kickboxing match, Estonians Polina Golubeva and Sigrid Kapanen battle it out and in another Estonian matchup Markko Sults takes on Aleks Sabinn. United Fight Alliance presents KOK 100 from Tallinn, Estonia part 2. In a bantamweight bout, Polish Muay Thai Champion Ilona Wojda faces Maarja Okva from Estonia. In a European bantamweight title fight, Finnish muay Thai champion Miina Sirkeoja takes on Estonian kickboxing and muay Thai champion Astrid Johanna Grents. In a light heavyweight matchup Mantas Janisius of Lithuania faces Estonian Zhora XXL. United Fight Alliance presents KOK 100 from Tallinn, Estonia part 3. Lithuanian Muay Thai champion Mindaugaus Marauskas steps into the ring with top contender and Estonian Muay Thai champion Ott Remmer. Hubert Dylewski of Poland faces Hendrik Themas of Estonia and in the Main Event is a rematch between two featherweights with the European title on the line, its World Kickboxing Champion Simon Santana of Norway versus Estonian Muay Thai Champion Marko Moisar.

programme.title: Experience Puerto Vallarta
programme.desc: Teri sets off to discover another side of Puerto Vallarta by experiencing luxury at it’s finest at the Casa Velas resort. She also explores the beauty of the vibrant huichol art and statues downtown before taking off for her underwater exploration at Las Caletas in Banderas Bay. Here she encounters sea urchins, sea horses, star fish, pufferfish and more.

programme.title: Redbird
programme.desc: If youve ever wanted to eat a standout meal from a veteran chef on the grounds of an old Baroque-style cathedral—and who hasnt?—Redbird can offer you that unique experience. The acclaimed restaurant is attached to the historic St. Vibiana cathedral downtown. Youve probably seen chef Neal Fraser on TV, whether it was cooking on Top Chef Masters or beating Bobby Flay in a fried chicken sandwich Throwdown, but hes also been one of LAs more influential chefs over his tenured career. Brunching in the spectacular glass-enclosed atrium courtyard is always a great idea, where you can munch on BLUEBERRY RICOTTA PANCAKES or more refined dishes like a FOIE GRAS TORCHON with strawberry and pink peppercorn. Dont miss happy hour either. CHICKEN-FRIED SWEETBREADS paired with a $7 gin cocktail is a hard offer to pass up.

programme.title: Duncan Lin
programme.desc: The Story of Duncan Lin“From my earliest memory, I have always liked drawing, but have never thought about making it my career,” says Duncan Lin, one of Taiwan’s most popular comics artists from Hualien. With a fanbase of 20 million and growing, Duncan has been approached by various renowned companies, such as Line, Asus, and TVBS for creative collaborations. He uses a caricature of himself as the main protagonist in his comics, which are centered around the hilarious going-ons of his daily life. With the cameras rolling, he wears his character as a mask, not wishing to expose his face. He is about 5’3, with a skinny frame, his dyed blonde hair peeking out from behind his mask. “My father always objected to my interest in drawing, but my mother was rather supportive. Some of my most precious memories are of those childhood drawings. I would show them to my mother, deeply excited, and she would look at them and say, ‘Oh, that’s [a] really nice picture’, and then display it on the fridge using a magnet. And I would feel so proud every time she did this. I would think, ‘Wow, I need to draw more, because I want more things to be displayed on the fridge’, and then slowly…. the fridge got filled up. And the old drawings would be removed, and the whole process would be repeated. And this small matter, and that fridge, they influenced me, and allowed me to feel like perhaps I should continue drawing in the future.”On the other hand, Duncan’s father was a strict figure, quite the opposite of his mother. “My father never smiled at me from the day I was born till the day he passed away. He never genuinely smiled at me and was always kind of distant - he’s a very, very strict kind of father - so we never really talked much, and of course after I graduated from high school, I left home.” Like all typical Asian parents, Duncan’s father hammered the notion: ‘do not pursue art because you’ll starve to death’, and that if he became an artist, ‘you’ll only earn money after you’re dead’.During his university years, Duncan majored i

programme.title: Wuzhen
programme.desc: Come visit Wuzhen, a 1,300-year-old water town on the lower reaches of the Yangtze River. Located on the Hangzhou-Jiaxing-Huzhou Plain in northern Zhejiang Province, it isat the center of the golden triangle consisting of Shanghai, Hangzhou and Suzhou. The most famous of the six “watertowns” in China, Wuzhen is commonly called “the Venice of the East” so taking a boat ride through the towns storied canals is a must. If you are going to make a day out of it, we recommend exploring the East section during the day and visiting the West section after 5p when the tourist crowds die down.

programme.title: Namie Osawa
programme.desc: You had me at, "Futuristic robots and sexy Japanese babes fighting off monsters!"We sat down with Namie Osawa, owner and founder of the world famous Robot Restaurant and her team. Namie’s futuristic robot-inspired venue is as visually stimulating as it is entertaining and interactive. She walks us through her inspiration for what now has become a staple experience for locals and global travellers.Interview: NAMIE OSAWA I opened Robot Restaurant three years ago. Even though I was hesitant to show the first concept to foreigners and so forth, I decided to open the restaurant in Kabukicho with the Japanese Businessman in mind. When thinking about what would be appealing to a businessman, I thought about Robots - which I longed for as a kid,..and Girls in sexy costumes. These were the things that initially came to mind. Our rehearsals begin at 11 o’clock in the morning including Wadaiko, which is a Japanese drum dance. We practice for about an hour and thirty minutes, then we have a brief meeting before the show. Rehearsals can be tough, but whatever we go over, ..it’s amazing and we have fun and I think it’s very good. Still, I think that there is a part where not a lot of the content catches on with the audience. Even after repeated viewings, I would like to think that each show was better than the one before it. But on the name alone, people were intrigued and when it arrived, it was beyond the imagination because I wanted it to be a thoughtful experience. Always keep going forward, it’s what we want out of this show. I want to make sure there’s more to it than just a name.

programme.title: A quintessential quarantine dish
programme.desc: With the world still in lockdown to combat the coronavirus, delicious food is a topic everyone can rally around. Euronews met up with Chef Othman Reif at his Japanese restaurant in Dubai, Kushiyaki, to taste one of his signature dishes. "You’re going to get a piece of Wagyu, thin cut. And we’re going to brush with a little bit of the wagyu fat. Just sear on the one side. Have a little bit of fun you know what I mean. It’s simple, easy you know, no hassle." Click on the video link above to see how its done. ​

programme.title: Kanda Myojin
programme.desc: Located in Chiyoda, this Shinto shrine has been watching over the neighborhoods of Kanda, Nihonbashi, Akihabara, Ootemachi, Marunouchi and others since the 14th century. Although the Gate of God suffered the fires, earthquakes and wars over the years, the rebuilt pavilion — decked out in stunning vermillion and gold with lacquered interiors — still attracts worshipers and visitors alike. Like the Kanda area itself, the shrine celebrates its history but also looks to the future. On any given day, you’ll find a mix of businessmen praying to the gods for luck and prosperity, young brides wishing for a good marriage, and others simply trying to ward of bad vibes. But the shrine’s priests started reaching out to younger generations with anime characters and charms that look like SD cards. Every other May, the shrine becomes a centerpiece for Kanda Matsuri, one of Tokyo’s most famous festivals since the Edo period. Locals parade with their favorite deities, or kami, through the neighborhoods, making their way to the shrine for the ultimate bash. If you think you have a samurai spirit, this should feel like home.

programme.title: London's Street Food Scene
programme.desc: From Korean BBQ burritos to stuffed bao buns, Nelson Sivalingam, founder & CEO of Wonderush, talks about his favorite London street food options. See them here!

programme.title: A Writer's Guide to Coffee Shops in NYC
programme.desc: Looking for the best coffee shops in NYC? Whether youre relaxing or getting work done, College Prepster blogger Carly Heitlinger knows New York coffee shops!

programme.title: Marco Bettio
programme.desc: Owner and founder Marco Bettio speaks about his journey to success, and bringing a bit of "Italian Love" to Shanghai.Marco’s infectious personality immediately disarms you, it’s no wonder Goodfellas is one of the city’s best establishments to find authentic Italian comfort food. His passion for authenticity and obsession for comfort, pours out every minute you spend here. This place has a charming personality and we went directly to the source.Interview: MARCO BETTIOWhen I came here 10 years ago and started to do some consulting. I started to receive a lot of guests from all around the world..and I was always forced to bring them to fine dining places. I noticed that my clients weren’t really comfortable in the fine dining experience the first day they arrived in Shanghai.That’s what moved me to bring this real Italian dining experience to this area. I would say that we would always try to give a tailormade type of service. Greeting everybody, making them feel comfortable, it’s one of the most important things for us.Actually, “Goodfellas”..is meant to mean “good friends”..and this is the idea. There is no ego, there is no name of the chef, or my name on the door,..nothing but “Goodfellas.” It’s a place to for a good time with your friends, business partners, clients..to have an intimate experience in an enjoyable way.Chef Antonio is a great master, we actually call him “the maestro”,..it’s the italian way to address a very experienced chef. Since day one, Chef has been in charge of everything inside the kitchen...scouting the best ingredients and creating the recipes. Coming from big hotels, he initially wanted the kitchen to be very serious, less smiling, less interactive, etc..I never agreed with this, so we had to find a balance. And it took almost a year until we found that balance,...after he saw the happy customers and atmosphere we knew we were on to something and it because very harmonic. There is never an argument between the kitchen and the staff, and it’s amazing. This is a very big achievement..norma

programme.title: La Mer: Dubai's bohemian beachfront
programme.desc: Postcards heads down to La Mer, Dubais newest beachfront development to check out the vintage-style beach huts, water sports, restaurants, bars, fashion stores and street art. A magnet for Instagrammers, La Mer is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside destinations. The street art here talks to its audience. Visitors can hire a sunbed or rent a whole day room on the sand, and the multi-coloured beach huts house showers. And, if you fancy an ice cream, youll find some interesting flavours. "Here at iScream , we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, ketchup, Mexican chilli-chocolate and you name it," says iSreams Managing Partner, Rami Halawi. ​At the confluence of north and south La Mer, you’ll find Laguna Water Park . Here you can test your courage on slides knotted with surprise twists and turns, or learn to surf on the 180-degree wave machine by Flowrider. For more wet and wild adventures, head to the beach – there are two water sports centres with a huge range of activities. Its also possible to explore the coast on a guided jet ski tour. Those who prefer airborne adventures can bounce around at Hawa Hawa , the weird and wavy trampoline-like playground imported from Japan. For those who just want to relax and chill out, dont worry, theres still plenty to do. Before day slips into night, secure a seat with sunset views at one of La Mer’s beautiful beachfront eateries. Masti is known for its mixology and its modern Indian cuisine. ​ If thats not enough, La Mer has a vintage-style cinema, fabulous street performers and seasonal celebrations to keep visitors entertained all night long. ​

programme.title: Video tour of St. George Island, Florida
programme.desc: This quiet island is less than a two-hour-drive south of Tallahassee, the states capital. This family-friendly destination features no mega-malls or putt-putt. Beaches and condos are the stars here.

programme.title: Overwater Bungalows at Sandals Grande St. Lucian, St. Lucia
programme.desc: We take you on a sneak peek tour of the new all-inclusive overwater bungalows at Sandals Grande St. Lucian, St. Lucia. The bungalows open to guests May 15, 2017.

programme.title: From kayaking to fitness workouts: Dubai enriches its offer for the health conscious traveller
programme.desc: With its untamed environment and rugged landscape, Hatta is the picture-perfect destination. And this centuries’ old exclave of Dubai also caters for today’s health conscious traveller. High up in the Hajar mountains you can soak up the history while doing a spot of hiking. There are 32 kilometres of track in the area. More than a dozen possible routes have been mapped out, with four different levels of ability. Kayaking is also on offer on the vast lake next to the Hatta dam. Fitness expert and Youtube star Lilly Sabri @lillysabri says the walking is an ideal complement to a regular routine. “I think that when you’re on a holiday you want to make memories as well… so trying different things,” she says. “So, if you’re someone goes to the gym wherever you normally train and in whatever country that might be, it might be nice to try something different. So, getting outside. You certainly couldn’t do this in London where I’m originally from. So, it’s keeping fit and healthy but in a different way.” Wellness tourism has evolved to become the travel industry’s fastest growing sector – something Dubai is continuing to expand upon and develop. Across town amongst the shimmering Jumeirah Lakes Towers you will find the SMSF Heartfulness Meditation Centre. It’s the only one of its kind in the MENA region and they hold daily meditation classes that attract up to 500 people. “I think we just forgot where... we’ve been so focused on external gratification... now people are actually zoning in and they realise what’s important on how we feel and how we can impact on those around us,” says fitness expert Christian Williams. “This place in Dubai is not just where people live, it’s a stop off where people go on vacation. So, what we’re doing here in Heartfulness Meditation is just incredible not just for people living here but anyone who is willing to come and travel. And I can just see us moving forwards and I’m just so pleased I came to this centre because it’s free and it’s on every single week.” “Dubai is gr

programme.title: Top 5 Things to do in the British Virgin Islands
programme.desc: Teri travels to the British Virgin Islands to explore the top things to do including sailing, diving, island hopping, indulging in spa treatments, and visiting the world famous Baths. Teri later visits the Bomba Shack on Tortola and talks with its legendary owner, Bomba.

programme.title: Adventures – Explore, dive and discover the sealife in Dubai’s waters
programme.desc: An hour and a half away from the city of Dubai, Euronews James OHagan joined the Dubai-based centre Divers Down to complete his PADI training and have his first proper dive. Michela Colella, Operations Manager, Divers Down UAE said, "We will go to an average depth of 14 metres. We’ll look for trumpet fish, triggerfish, clownfish, pufferfish, boxfish." Even with the basic training completed, diving with an instructor helps you feel safer, develop the right habits, and take in all the best spots on the dive site. Some of the most spectacular coral and marine life are located just 5 metres from the surface. At that depth, everything is lit up beautifully and the air lasts much longer than at 10 or 15 metres. The reef has species ranging from stingrays to lobsters, jawfish, parrotfish, broomtail wrasse, and many others. For more experienced divers there are dozens of shipwrecks and artificial reefs to explore each with unique histories and coral formations. At times it feels as if you’re flying in slow motion in some sort of alien landscape. And before you know it, it’s time to come back to the real world. Euronews James OHagan exclaimed, "Oh! That was incredible! Breathtaking!

programme.title: Did you know Dubai is fifth most instagrammed city in the world?
programme.desc: Dubai has been named the 5th most Instagrammed city in the world in a survey by travel site Wego. From its sweeping beaches, to standout architecture and world class restaurants, there’s a photo opportunity to be found at every landmark and for every occasion. In fact, food is one of the main reasons for visiting the city. Dubai led the way in the food category for Instagram hashtags with a massive 26 per cent of all hashtags in or including Dubai also including food. This summer alone there were 79 million hashtags related to Dubai. Some of the hotspots include the city’s Miracle Garden which is the largest flower garden in the world. It has 72,000 square metres with over 50 million blooming flowers. As well as the Miracle Garden, downtown Dubai is also home to the Burj Khalifa which is also one of the top five most instagrammed places in the city. And in the city’s centrally located Zabeel Park you can find Dubai Frame, an architectural landmark. This 150-metre-high, 93-metre-wide structure is positioned so that visitors can soak in the views of modern Dubai to the south and old Dubai to the north. Mamoun Hmedan, Managing Director, MENA and India, Wego says the ranking is a huge achievement for Dubai. “Dubai is the one and only Arab city that’s ranked within the top five. That’s a lot for one city compared to very well-established tourism destinations,” he says. The top city in terms of hashtags was London with 118 million posts. Next was Paris with 101 million, followed by Nice and New York who received 87 million and 83 million respectively. Other top hashtags include Istanbul, Jakarta, Los Angeles, Barcelona, Moscow, and Tokyo. Sarah Hedley Hymers is a travel journalist and social media influencer. She says putting photos on Instagram is all about social capital. “You want to present something that is aspirational," she explains. "It has to be well-framed. It has to be colourful – dark pictures don’t do so well on Instagram. So, you’re looking for something that is bright, that real

programme.title: Sak Yant Tattoo
programme.desc: Traditional hand needle tattoos have been a staple of Thai culture for centuries with the common practitioners being Buddhist monks. Why? The spiritual significance and meanings behind the permanent body art are manifestations of the individual’s aura. Ajarn Noo, a former Buddhist monk turned spiritual Thai tattoo master, has gained international recognition since tattooing Angelina Jolie and consequently many other celebrities like Michele Rodriguez and David Beckham. His tattoo parlor is unlike any you’ve ever been to because he performs the spiritual practice in the sanctuary of his own home. Walk past the larger than life statues devoted to Buddha, up the stairs and into the top floor of his residence There you will find photos adorning his walls of countless celebrities, the royal family and others who have come before you. You can than evaluate your various options but here is the kicker – there is no guarantee you will get the tattoo you are looking for. You must first stand before Ajarn Noo for a spiritual evaluation and based on each individual’s aura, Ajarn Noo will either approve and customize a tattoo for you based on your own spirit or send you packing. So come with a clear heart, a clear mind and let your inner soul speak to Ajarn in hopes of a tattoo blessing that will be unlike any other.

programme.title: Bold And Beautiful NYC Destinations
programme.desc: Your travel guide to the best of NYC attractions. From Chelsea to Chinatown to parks in Manhattan and Brooklyn.

programme.title: Toh A
programme.desc: In the wave of casual fine dining sweeping Asia, Toh A offers French-Taiwanese fusion that packs a nice punch. In addition to the set menu of excellence, the next most intriguing part of the restaurant is surely its interior design. Built during the Japanese colonial period, the building is over a hundred years old and was even used as a previous dormitory for the National Taiwan University. The original wooden rooftop still remains within the walled gates that open up to modern , Asian interior design that immediately make the outside world melt away. With a rotational set menu, Toh A offers a culinary experience that presents traditional Taiwanese cuisine with a modern French twist unlike any other establishment in Taipei today.

programme.title: Setting Our Sights on South Beach
programme.desc: From Food & Wine to Gay Pride, South Beach is the place to be for good eats & culture. Discover whats happening on this weeks episode of We Hear!

programme.title: Mrs. Pound
programme.desc: Dont judge a book by its cover, this is not your average stamp shop. Inspired by a fictional story of secret lovers, Mrs. Pound brings to life the story of a former 1950s Shanghai burlesque dancer, her married lover (Mr. Ming) and their elaborate clandestine rendezvous space. Offering a new twist on asian fusion cuisine, the 45 seat venue features a lower dining room (Mrs. Pound), an upper dining room (Mr . Ming), and a bar area at which these two spaces merge. Mixed with plush velvet banquettes, vintage tiles, neon artwork, suspended mirrored marquee lights with lipstick messages, and a 1960s style showgirl glamour, Mrs. Pounds creative interior sets the tone for a unique and entertaining culinary (and drinking) experience. We like the Hainanese Chicken Rice, Thai Milk Tea Cake, Sriracha Street Corn, and Lemongrass Pork Chop. Although it will be a longer wait, do yourself a favor and go for dinner for the best experience.

programme.title: "This is insane" Supercar Blondie's F1 crash course
programme.desc: Euronews Evan Bourke joins social media star, Supercar Blondie , to test drive an F1 racing car in Dubai. Shes become a social media sensation for testing out some of the worlds most beautiful cars, so what better way to meet Supercar Blondie , than to propose a test drive in the ultimate racing machine - an F1 race car. Euronews Dubai based correspondent Evan Bourke was given the breathtakingly gruesome job -honestly, his colleagues are not jealous - of having to take part in the test drive at the Dubai Autodome . The race track is one of the few places in the world where it is possible to get in an F1 car and experience the adrenaline rush that 6G and more than 500 horsepower has to offer. Supercarblondie has six million Instagram followers and is known for her love of Supercars but even this was a first for her. To watch the full episode of Adventures, click on the video link above.

programme.title: Off the beaten track, Orlando
programme.desc: Out of the many adventures one can have in Orlando, I choose the off the beaten path things to do. My journey begins at the Orlando World Center Marriott, home to the biggest most amazing pool I’ve ever seen. What makes it even more amazing is the fact that mermaid classes are offered through the Mermaid Academy, poolside. The real adventure begins at the Paddling Center at Shingle Creek, which is a quick drive from the hotel. Lined with Cypress trees and the beautiful sounds of nature, it was the perfect setting for a relaxing kayak experience. I end my time in Orlando shopping at Artegon Marketplace. This is mall filled with local artisans who are passionate about their work and products. My highlight was being able to ride on a cute stuffed mechanical animal as I peruse the shops.

programme.title: St. Petersburg Florida
programme.desc: St. Petersburg, Florida is one of Florida’s best kept secrets! It’s an art filled city perfect for nature lovers, adventurers, families and couples. It has some of the best beaches in the world, a burgeoning art and culinary scene and the largest collection Salvador Dali works of art outside of Europe.

programme.title: Visit Curacao: Explore the Culture, Music and Adventure
programme.desc: Curacao, or Korso in the native Papiamento, is the most authentic, populous and cosmopolitan of the ABC islands the Dutch Antilles. It is a cultural enthusiast’s dream and a language lover’s paradise.

programme.title: Eating Healthy in L.A.
programme.desc: Food expert Jackie Gebel, @noleftovers on Instagram, dishes on the amazing L.A. health food scene. Check out her guide to the best healthy eats in L.A.!

programme.title: What to do in Pompano Beach
programme.desc: One of South Florida’s hidden gems is Pompano Beach, Florida. Located just north of Fort Lauderdale, this quiet beach town is perfect for those who prefer less crowds and a laid back atmosphere. It’s ideal location makes access to other South Florida towns, including Miami, super easy. I start my journey at the Fort Lauderdale Marriott Pompano Beach Resort & Spa. It has the most amazing sunrises which I delighted in each day from my private balcony. The hotel is located directly on the beach which makes it very difficult to leave. I visit the charming beachside town of Lauderdale by the Sea, a 10 minute drive from my hotel. I also take a tour at Butterfly World, the first and largest butterfly house in the United States. It is home over 80 species of butterflies, hummingbird and lorikeet aviaries, and outdoor gardens. This place is truly magical for people of all ages. Pompano Beach is the quintessential beach town. You can truly relax and enjoy the beach at your own pace while indulging as much or as little as you’d like.

programme.title: Beijing
programme.desc: Being the capital of China is a colossal responsibility. With over a billion people watching, Beijing seems to manage the task with dignified ease. The pace of life in this city speaks volumes about its personality and its characters. The mood is steady, confident, and proud. With walls that never end, ducks that bear golden skin, and Forbidden Cities out in the open, Beijing has a storybook magic that can only be found in a megacity overflowing with such rich history and tradition. The landmarks and landscapes are dominant forces, followed by the new developments mounted by modernization. Knowing where to look will be the key to unlocking the cities best adventures and experiences. Don’t be afraid to explore the many interesting nooks and crannies of Beijing’s streets and alleys, as there are many. From the bucket list worthy monuments, to the waves of new restaurants, shops, and cultural encounters available, be sure not to rush. Beijing is a hotbed of commerce and entrepreneurship, and inspires the country’s top artists, students, writers, film-makers, musicians, and creatives to converge within its frontiers. With so much to explore in one of the oldest cities on the planet, traveling somewhere else seems irresponsible - there’s no place like ‘the capital.’

programme.title: Exploring Virgin Gorda in the British Virgin Islands
programme.desc: Teri meets with Miss World BVI who tells her a little about the islands before they jump into their bikinis and explore the world famous Baths in Virgin Gorda. Teri later talks to Celebrity Chef Fed about what hes doing in Virgin Gorda for Restaurant Week.

programme.title: Li Qun Duck
programme.desc: Zhang Li Qun welcomes you to his home to experience this classic delicacy. And when we say classic, we mean the ultimate classic. Throughout the years, there have been many spins on Peking Duck, even in Beijing. However, Li Qun Duck roasts their duck in accordance with the Qing Imperial Kitchen and their production methods, including the traditional hanging furnace technique. In a very proud city rich with historical heritage, this is about as local as it gets. Tucked away in the winding hutongs of the Qianmen area, do not miss this hidden gem….you will savor this taste of old Beijing for eternity.

programme.title: Ethnic Restaurants in Manhattan
programme.desc: World traveler Carlos Garcia shares his favorite ethnic food in NYC, from authentic Italian to savory Ethiopian. Check out his list here!

programme.title: Fun Things to do in Brooklyn
programme.desc: Learn where adults go for ice cream, bowling, video games, & other fun kid things adults can do in Brooklyn. Andrew Zimmer gives his local insight!

programme.title: Scopa Italian Roots
programme.desc: Scopas airplane hangar-like space in Venice is dominated by a 50-foot bar, communal high-tops, booming acoustics, and a jovial crowd at happy hour. The resulting vibe can only be described as surprisingly pleasant chaos. Bartenders are yelling out NEGRONI orders, servers are dancing around tables to drop Italian cold-cut platters, and diners are leaning in to converse over piles of handmade noodles.About those noodles: Top Chef vet Antonia Lofaso cooks upscale Italian with no fuss, like RIGATONI with vodka sauce and more modern takes like CRESTE RIGATE with morels and English peas. She smears nutty ricotta on ciabatta crostini and then leaves it rightly un-messed-with except for some quality olive oil and fresh parsley. The DEEP-FRIED FLUFFERNUTTER for dessert reminds you that life—and perhaps cardiac health—shouldnt be taken too seriously.

programme.title: Top Ten Things to do in St. Maarten
programme.desc: Here are my top 10 things to do in St. Maarten plus the details on how to do them.... 1. Taste local Rum - Visit Toppers Rhum Factory. www.toppersrhum.com/ 2. Visit Nectar of St. Maarten for natural / organic skin care, protection and bug repellent. These products are sold throughout the islands and are amazing!! 3. Party - Come during Carnival and experience Jouvert and party with the locals. 4. Watch the sunset – It is absolutely gorgeous, especially at Divi Little Bay - http://www.diviresorts.com/divi-littl... 5. Stroll in Philipsburg and visit Guavaberry Emporium - http://www.guavaberry.com/ 6. Ride in a water UFO - An Unbelievably fun object.. http://water-ufo.com/ 7. Go shopping at the Marigot Market on the French side 8. Visit Loterie Farm in the hills of Pic Paradis to be surrounded by nature as you zipline, party or relax by the pool. http://loteriefarm.com/ 9. Visit Orient Beach - Its on the French side and is the most popular beach on the island. It is also home to Club Orient which is a clothing optional beach resort. 10. Watch the extreme airport landings from Maho Beach. Schedule some time before your flight home to experience this.

programme.title: To Be Clear: Dawn Montgomery & Freddie B Talk New Podcast & Diddy Trial
programme.desc: Award-winning journalist Dawn Montgomery and actor and host Freddie B talk about the launch of their new podcast, "To Be Clear," which takes a bold and unfiltered approach to headlines and hot topics. They also talked about the ongoing Diddy trial and the urgency to hold powerful men in the entertainment industry accountable. Plus, Dawn opens up about her decision to leave Revolt TV in 2023 after Cassie filed a lawsuit against the hip hop mogul.

programme.title: A Purpose-Driven Commitment to Performance-Driven DEI
programme.desc: Performance mindsets in business can range from compliance (doing the work) and commitment (doing the work well) to passion (getting personal satisfaction from doing the work well). However, a person or organization is motivated by mission is most likely to deliver performance excellence over time. Nationally recognized DEI leader and practitioner Michelle Taylor-Jones shares how her service-oriented sense of mission drives global results for the customers, employees and communities impacted by ManuLife JohnHancock.

programme.title: Continued Coverage from Inside the 2015 International Auto Shows
programme.desc: On this edition of Our World with Black Enterprise, we continue our coverage of the 2015 International Auto Shows from both Detroit and New York City. First up, we sit down with Mark Fields, CEO and president of Ford Motor Company. His recent promotion to his current position was accentuated by the F-150 Raptor, winner of this years Award for Truck/ Utility. Then, we visited the Mercedes Benz USA President and CEO Stephen Cannon, who gave us a tour of one of the new exciting cars driving off its manufacturing lines. John Mendel, executive vice president for Honda, shares his strategy for reaching a diverse market with his cars, and hes looking toward the sky for inspiration. Jim Lentz, chairman of Toyota North America, has a solid strategy to convince consumers to buy Toyotas newest and hottest cars. And finally Brian Smith, vice president for Lexus Luxury Division, explains why digital devices and technology inside this years newest cars is taking luxury brand cars to the next level.

programme.title: Preparing For The Cost To Be The Boss

programme.desc: Enjoy Seasons of Lake Tahoe Free in February. Relax and unwind with the spectacular scenery of Lake Tahoe. This 3 hour film explores the dramatic beauty of one of the worlds most beautiful locations. Experience brilliant turquoise waters, snowy wonderlands, slow motion waterfalls, sunny beaches, and exhilarating aerial views in this breathtaking film. Feel your worries melt away, your heart rate slow, and breath deepen with each relaxing scene.

programme.title: Journey Through Joshua Tree Relaxing Nature Film
programme.desc: Explore a wonderland of unique desert life in "Journey Through Joshua Tree." Enjoy a calming acoustic guitar soundtrack along with the stunning beauty of this desert landscape. Runtime 75 minutes.

programme.title: EPIC MOTIVATIONAL Top Speeches VOL 2
programme.desc: If you feel like giving up, this video is for you! Get back in the game of life!
